intro: Brachystelma caffrum, commonly known as the Cape star. It is a succulent plant native to South Africa, characterized by its compact, star-shaped leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known as the ice plant family, and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically during the summer months. Brachystelma caffrum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
